intro: Vinticena kerstingii, commonly known as the Kersting's vinticena, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
